translation: Ben MUST be swimming (right now).

Ann SHOULD be at the lake right now.
comment: less ‘correct’; tzrikha literally can be translated as “need”, so it is “less correct” in the sense that the literal translation does not match the weak necessity interpretation

translation: Mary SHOULD be at home
comment: amoora fits better in this context. amoora = need
